alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Magoffin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 3:58PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Floyd, west central Pike and southeastern Magoffin Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 356 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gunlock, or 14 miles north of Hindman, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mid around 400 PM EDT. Hippo, Hueysville, Pyramid, Bosco and Blue River around 405 PM EDT. Estill, Wayland, Langley, Eastern, Garret, Porter Junction and Glo around 410 PM EDT. Martin, Allen, Printer, Hunter, Alphoretta, Drift, Arkansas, Minnie, McDowell and East McDowell around 415 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Honaker, Blue Moon, Dana, Ivel, Banner, Craynor, Boldman, Aluba, Harold, Betsy Layne, Grethel, Justell, Osborn and Galveston. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Kentucky Highway 80 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 13. U.S. Highway 23 in Floyd County between mile markers 1 and 11. U.S. Highway 23 in Pike County between mile markers 31 and 32. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for southeastern Kentucky.
